title: Elaborate single-page theme with right-aligned link-style navigation and scroll-aware active states

requirements.summary: Right-align the desktop header navigation to the top-right of the header and increase its visual size without overlap.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop widths (md and up), the navigation links render aligned to the right side of the header area.
Navigation link text is visibly larger than the current `text-sm` styling (e.g., `text-base` or equivalent), while remaining responsive and not wrapping unexpectedly.
No layout overlap occurs between the logo/company name and the navigation items at common viewport widths.

file_operations.description: Adjust the header layout so the desktop nav sits to the right of the logo and is right-aligned (e.g., use flex growth/`ml-auto` patterns) and increase link typography from the current `text-sm` to a larger responsive size; ensure no overlap with logo/company name at md+ widths.

Add cohesive nav typography/spacing utility styles (e.g., a shared nav-link class for md+ sizing/letter-spacing) to support the larger desktop menu while keeping responsive behavior consistent across the site.

requirements.summary: Convert desktop navigation to link-style presentation with hover and scroll-synced active state while preserving smooth scroll.
acceptanceCriteria: Desktop nav items are styled as links (e.g., underline/indicator on hover and active) rather than button-like UI.
As the user scrolls through the single-page sections (`home`, `about`, `services`, `contact`), the corresponding nav item reflects an active state.
Clicking a nav link still smooth-scrolls to the correct section (existing behavior preserved).

file_operations.description: Create a hook that tracks the currently active section among `home`, `about`, `services`, and `contact` based on scroll position (e.g., via IntersectionObserver) and returns the active section id for nav highlighting.

Replace button-like desktop nav items with true link-style elements (anchor semantics) that still smooth-scroll on click; use the active section from `useActiveSection` to render active/selected state (e.g., underline/indicator and `aria-current`).
Align mobile menu items with the same link-mode styling direction (less button-like) and optionally reflect the active section for consistency with desktop behavior.
Implement consistent link-mode nav styles (hover + active indicator/underline) using the existing Tailwind/CSS-variable approach; avoid one-off per-section styles.

requirements.summary: Increase visual richness across Home/About/Services/Contact while keeping the same single-page structure and section IDs.
acceptanceCriteria: The Home, About, Services, and Contact sections remain present and reachable via the header navigation.
Each section shows a noticeable increase in visual richness (improved spacing, typography hierarchy, and/or decorative layout elements) without adding new top-level pages.
Mobile responsiveness is maintained (no horizontal overflow; content remains readable and properly spaced on small screens).

file_operations.description: Introduce reusable section/layout utility classes (e.g., section spacing, subtle separators, background treatments, typography rhythm) to make the page feel more elaborate without adding new routes or breaking responsiveness.

Enhance hero composition and hierarchy (e.g., improved spacing rhythm, refined badge/heading/subtitle alignment, and decorative separator treatment) while keeping the `home` section id and existing smooth-scroll CTA behavior. Uses existing shadcn-ui Button component for CTAs; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Polish About section presentation (typography hierarchy, spacing, and card-like treatments for stats/partners) while keeping the `about` id and current content source unchanged.

Elevate Services section with improved grid rhythm and more polished Card presentation while keeping the `services` id and content mapping intact. Uses existing shadcn-ui Card components; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refine Contact section layout density and visual hierarchy (info block + form balance, improved spacing, subtle background/separator) while keeping the `contact` id and current contact form behavior intact.

Polish the form container/fields presentation for a more elaborate feel (spacing, headings/labels rhythm, success state styling) without adding third-party services or new pages. Uses existing shadcn-ui form primitives (Button/Input/Textarea/Label); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive visual theme (colors, typography, accents) consistently across header, sections, and footer.
acceptanceCriteria: Header, section blocks, and footer share consistent styling decisions (typography scale, spacing, and accent usage).
Theme is implemented using existing Tailwind/CSS variable approach and does not introduce inconsistent one-off styles across sections.

file_operations.description: Strengthen the site-wide theme using the existing CSS variable + Tailwind approach (e.g., consistent accent usage, section background tokens, and typography rhythm utilities) and ensure styles are applied consistently (not as isolated one-offs).
Align header styling with the updated cohesive theme (consistent background, border, nav link indicators, and spacing) while maintaining sticky behavior and responsiveness.
Update footer styling to match the same theme accents and typography scale as the header/sections, keeping its structure and smooth-scroll quick links intact.

If needed to support the cohesive theme, extend Tailwind tokens (e.g., additional shadows/animations/typography scale) in a centralized way consistent with existing configuration, avoiding scattered one-off inline styles.
